job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
JOIN US!
Symphony RetailAI is the global leader in artificial intelligence-enabled solutions for FMCG retailers and CPG manufacturers. From customer intelligence to personalized marketing, and merchandising and category management, to supply chain and retail operations. This is an exciting time to join a fast moving, high growth Company. Our team share a passion for retail, data and technology - we love to celebrate success and we'd like you to join us on our exciting journey! We offer fantastic benefits including flexible working policies, summer working hours and the chance to have some fun with your colleagues!
Check us out here and hear from our Chairman and CEO about why retailers and CPG choose us as well as find out more about us!
THE OPPORTUNITY
This Data Scientist will be part of a team that leverages AI to solve business challenges faced by our clients. In particular, this team will be focused on developing algorithms and models to uncover opportunities and support client decision-making related to promotions, advertising, vendor negotiations and assortments. We gauge success based on actionable insights that result in measurable business value, thus the ability to turn diagnostic and predictive analytics into prescriptive insight is vital to success of the role.
We are looking for a creative and curious problem solver who is passionate about data science. We have a team culture that encourages innovation, expects a high level of ownership, and takes pride in what we do!
KEY ACTIVITIES
Apply analytical techniques to identify actionable insights
Understand a business need expressed by a client or client team member and think creatively to identify opportunities to solve their pain points or strategic questions
Determine the types of data necessary and the optimal AI / statistical technique to derive actionable insights
Present and explain outcomes to client team members, iterating as needed
Collaborate with product R&D to translate and deploy proven models into future CINDE releases
KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field is required
Good knowledge of databases as well as relevant programming skills – e.g., R, Python
Understanding how algorithms work: learning methods (supervised, semi-supervised, unsupervised, reinforced), decision trees, neural networks, statistical algorithms
Strong, demonstrable problem-solving skills.
Ability to clearly communicate technical content to business people, using words and visualizations.
Self-starter who likes to work independently and with groups to achieve optimal performance
Enjoys working in a dynamic work environment
Must be detail and quality oriented
We will be over the moon if you also have:
a Masters / MBA
Experience working with customer centric data / loyalty data
Experience leveraging data and analytics for category management / merchandising decision making
